Comment 4: 
There are only two goroutines here so gdb shouldn't show too many threads.  You can use
"info threads" to see the threads and "thread N" to change to a thread.  You can use
"bt" to get a backtrace for the current thread.

If the system still works, but the program does not respond to signals, that suggests
that signals have somehow been blocked.  I don't see how that could happen but I have no
other suggestions.
